info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 3 at 8:52PM MST until September 3 at 9:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona...
* Until 945 PM MST.
* At 852 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Arizona State Fairgrounds to Phoenix International Raceway to 7 miles southeast of Estrella Mountain Park, moving northwest at 15 mph.
HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph.
SOURCE...Doppler radar.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 111 and 137. US Highway 60 between mile markers 139 and 148. AZ Route 101 between mile markers 2 and 9.
Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Glendale, Surprise, Avondale, Goodyear, Buckeye, El Mirage, Tolleson, Youngtown, Sun City West, Waddell, Cashion, Sun City, Litchfield Park, and Palo Verde.
info.instruction:
Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
